titleStmt.title: Medial /a/ in stressed closed syllable before /a/ (*maCCaC)

sourceDesc.p: This is the feature-file for Raising of a in stressed closed syllable before a - maCCaC

revisionDesc.change: updating references to Zotero IDs via update-bibl-refs.xsl

item.label: a > a and i become schwa for the Maghreb

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Elderly (70+), Old (60-70) and some middle age speakers show consistent raising of short medial a in stressed closed syllable.
Young speakers and some middle-aged speakers do not show raising of short medial a in stressed closed syllable, unlike Elderly (70+), Old (60-70) and some middle age speakers who do show it.

cit.quote: traditional dish made with rice, yogurt and meat or chicken
traditional dish made with rice, yogurt and meat or chicken

wib:featureValueObservation.note: Herin 2010: 111 Il se peut que ce préfixe mi- soit d'origine bédouine puisque dans ces variétés, la voyelle /a/ a tendance, dans certains environnements, à se fermer. On peut aussi penser que le schème miCCaC, qui est aussi attesté dans la langue standard, ait dans un stade antérieur supplanté maCCaC. Ce dernier aurait été réintroduit au contact d'autres variétés.
The author notes that the pattern mifʕala (midrasa) is also used, but very rarely.
The word mitjar is now vesitigial, the favoured standard word for 'airport' is ajruport
normally both a become ə, here because of ʕ > a

cit.quote: false nest made by the partridge
